intro: Tanacetum cotuloides, commonly known as field chrysanthemum, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Tanacetum cotuloides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
